thread.title: Saints Travel To Face Colts – Game Preview
thread.title_full: Saints Travel To Face Colts – Game Preview

author: Steve Peloquin
title: Saints Travel To Face Colts – Game Preview
text:
(Photo by Sean Gardner/Getty Images) 

The New Orleans Saints return to action on Sunday afternoon, when they travel to Indianapolis, Indiana to take on the Indianapolis Colts in a match-up of NFC/AFC foes. 
Kickoff time at Lucas Oil Stadium is scheduled for noon, and you can hear all the play-by-play action on ESPN 1420, as well as 97.3 The Dawg. 
The game marks the final road game before the Saints open up a two-game home stand. New Orleans, defeated Atlanta, 31-21, back on October 15, will enter the game at 2-4, while Indianapolis, who fell to the New England Patriots, 34-27, last week, is currently 3-3. The Saints lead the all-time series between the two franchises, 7-5, including a dominating 62-7 win over the Colts back in 2011, the last time the two franchises met. 
Offensively, the Saints are averaging 22.3 points-per-game, along with 387.0 total yards, including 302.3 passing yards, and 84.7 rushing yards-per-game. 
New Orleans is led by quarterback Drew Brees, who has thrown for 1,304 yards and six touchdowns, along with running back Mark Ingram, who has rushed for 261 yards and two touchdowns, and receiver Brandin Cooks, who has caught 25 passes for 322 yards and a touchdown. 
The Colts, offensively, are averaging 21.0 points, 347.2 total yards, 250.5 passing yards, and 96.7 rushing yards a game. 
Indianapolis is paced by quarterback Matt Ryan, who has thrown for 1,456 yards and 6 touchdowns, running back Devonta Freeman, who has rushed for 405 yards and eight touchdowns, and receiver Julio Jones, who has caught 43 passes for 545 yards and four scores. 
Defensively, the Saints are giving an average of 409.7 yards-per-game, worst in the league, including 271.5 passing yards and 138.2 rushing yards, while the Colts are allowing 401.8 total yards, which ranks 29th, including 289.2 passing yards and 112.7 rushing yards.
